sentence.Network_en: Old World sandpiper with a curved bill like a curlew.
sentence.Network_cn: 东半球矶鹬,嘴巴弯曲象麻鹬.

sentence.Network_en: New World curlew that breeds in northern North America.
sentence.Network_cn: 在北美洲北部繁殖的新大陆杓鹬.

sentence.Network_en: He could hear the unearthly scream of some curlew piercing the din.
sentence.Network_cn: 他可以听到一些杓鹬所发出的那种穿透喧嚣的诡异叫声.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French courlieu, alteration (by association with courliu 'courier', from courre 'run' + lieu 'place') of imitative courlis

entry.tran: 杓鹬(生活在水边的棕黄色大型鸟，腿长，喙长而弯，叫声独特)
entry.def: A curlew is a large brown bird with long legs and a long curved beak. Curlews live near water and have a very distinctive cry.

means.word_mean: 1. large migratory shorebirds of the sandpiper family; closely related to woodcocks but having a down-curved bill
